author: Harry Wilson, Jason Leopold, Jeff Kao, Ava Benny-Morrison, Surya Mattu, Max Abelson, Dhruv Mehrotra
description: Peter Mandelson, the prominent Labour politician who was named British ambassador to the US this year, expressed steadfast support and offered to discuss Epstein’s now-infamous 2008 case with his contacts.
title: UK Ambassador Told Epstein ‘I Think the World of You,’ Emails Reveal

author: Elizabeth Stanton
description: Wall Street bond dealers came closer than ever Wednesday to missing out on the Treasury Department’s monthly auction of 10-year notes, marking a steady decline in participation rates in the burgeoning market.
title: Big Banks Nearly Get Shut Out of Treasury 10-Year Auction

author: Macarena Munoz Montijano
description: The Spanish Parliament voted down Prime Minister Pedro Sanchez’s proposal to reduce the working week in the latest setback to his struggling minority government.
title: Spanish Parliament Blocks Shorter Work Week in Blow to Sanchez

author: Janet Lorin
description: Harvard University said it has received notice that some of the federal research funding frozen by the Trump administration is being restarted, although the money hasn’t been restored yet.
title: Harvard Says Trump Administration to Restore Some Research Funds

author: Jarrell Dillard
description: The US will need to rely on immigration to keep its population expanding in 2031 — two years earlier than previously projected — due in part to President Donald Trump’s policies, the Congressional Budget Office said Wednesday.
title: US Will Need Migrants for Population Growth by 2031, CBO Says

author: Erik Larson, Chris Dolmetsch
description: President Donald Trump has moved to fire Federal Reserve Governor Lisa Cook after she refused his demand to resign over a claim by a top administration official that she lied on mortgage applications. The escalation sets the stage for a legal battle that will help determine the extent of White House control over the US central bank.
title: Can Trump Really Fire Fed Governor Cook? Here’s What the Law Says

author: Carolina Millan
description: Mexico is looking to raise tariffs on cars made in Asia to as much as 50%, according to Economy Minister Marcelo Ebrard.
title: Mexico Seeks to Raise Tariffs on Cars Made in Asia to Up to 50%

author: Natalia Drozdiak, Andrea Palasciano, Maciej Martewicz, Ellen Milligan
description: Poland has asked allies for additional air defense systems and counter-drone technology to better protect its land from Russian incursions, according to people familiar with the matter.
title: Poland Seeks More Allied Air Defense After Russian Drone Strike

author: Alister Bull
description: South Africa said it was “deeply concerned” by a Russian attack that killed Ukrainian pensioners, striking a more critical tone of Moscow than usual as it repeated its desire to help find peace.
title: South Africa Makes Rare Criticism of Russia After Ukraine Attack

author: Erik Wasson, Steven T. Dennis
description: Democrats are threatening to block a bill needed to avert an Oct. 1 US government shutdown unless Republicans agree to stop a sharp spike in Obamacare health insurance premiums or meet other demands by the minority party.
title: Democrats Threaten US Shutdown as Obamacare Premium Fight Rages

author: Brian Platt
description: Canadian Prime Minister Mark Carney says he’ll announce Thursday the first wave of major projects to be fast-tracked under a new law passed by his government.
title: Carney Says Major Projects Coming to Combat Trade War ‘Crisis’

author: Michelle Kaske
description: New York’s Long Island Rail Road, the biggest commuter line in the US, is facing a potential strike next week as locomotive engineers currently vote on whether to authorize a work stoppage — and Governor Kathy Hochul is blaming President Donald Trump for the growing crisis.
title: Hochul Blames Trump for Looming Long Island Rail Strike

author: Oma Seddiq, Emily Birnbaum
description: Republican Senator Ted Cruz kicked off a debate over artificial intelligence policy by proposing legislation to enshrine a “light-touch” approach to regulating the emerging technology.
title: Key GOP Senator Opens AI Regulation Debate Urging a Light Touch

author: Alister Bull
description: South Africa will reopen the inquest into the 1977 killing of anti-apartheid activist Steve Biko, whose death after alleged torture by the apartheid authorities provoked worldwide condemnation.
title: South Africa to Reopen Inquest Into 1977 Death of Steve Biko

author: Sam Dagher
description: Arab leaders across the Middle East are questioning the value of American security guarantees in the wake of Israel’s unprecedented assault on Qatar — a major US ally and home to Washington’s biggest military base in the region.
title: Israel’s Qatar Attack Has Gulf Questioning US Security Guarantee

author: Laura Nahmias
description: New York Governor Kathy Hochul said she’s a “staunch capitalist” and would work to ensure New York remains attractive to businesses if democratic socialist Zohran Mamdani is elected mayor of New York City.
title: ‘Staunch Capitalist’ Hochul Says She Doesn’t Want NY Tax Hikes

author: Erik Larson, Zoe Tillman
description: The US Justice Department appealed a judge’s decision that temporarily blocks President Donald Trump from ousting Federal Reserve Governor Lisa Cook over allegations of mortgage fraud, keeping the case on track to end up at the Supreme Court.
title: Trump Asks Appeals Court to Let Him Oust Fed’s Lisa Cook

author: Eric Martin
description: Secretary of State Marco Rubio told South Korean Foreign Minister Cho Hyun that the US welcomes Seoul’s investments and wants to deepen cooperation, amid uproar over an immigration raid that detained hundreds of the Asian nation’s citizens at a battery plant in Georgia.
title: Rubio Says US Welcomes South Korea Investment as Raid Tests Ties

author: Eliyahu Kamisher, Michelle Ma
description: California lawmakers have reached an initial agreement to shore up the state’s wildfire utility fund.
title: California Plans to Boost Wildfire Fund by $18 Billion

author: Nicola M White
description: Securities and Exchange Commission Chairman Paul Atkins tapped a key player for his leadership team Wednesday, appointing a corporate attorney to head the unit tasked with reviewing initial public offerings and scrutinizing company disclosures.
title: SEC Gets Chief for Unit Overseeing IPOs, Corporate Disclosures

author: Erin Hudson
description: For decades, a coalition of educators and mostly Republican lawmakers in the US have pushed for the use of public funding to subsidize private education options. That advocacy has resulted in a multitude of state-level “school choice” programs that help parents cover private education costs. The number of children enrolled in these programs more than doubled between 2019 and 2024.
title: How School Choice Went from Conservative Cause to Federal Policy

author: Kati Pohjanpalo, Andrea Palasciano
description: With Russia’s invasion of Ukraine in its fourth year, and the US wavering in its commitment to Western European security, there’s speculation that Russian President Vladimir Putin is testing NATO’s collective security arrangements.
title: What to Know About NATO, Russia and Articles 4 & 5

author: Aashna Shah
description: The US Department of Transportation is starting an investigation of North Carolina’s light rail system after a woman was stabbed to death last month.
title: Charlotte Light Rail Safety Probed as Trump Blames Democrats for Stabbing

author: Ari Natter
description: Five US offshore wind developments are under review, a top Trump administration official said on Wednesday, as the White House targets the renewable energy source.
title: Five Offshore Wind Projects Under Review, Burgum Says

author: Jamie Tarabay
description: A key Senate Democrat investigating the flow of funds in and out of bank accounts belonging to disgraced financier Jeffrey Epstein has drafted new legislation that, if passed, would compel the Treasury Department to hand over its records.
title: Wyden Pushes Senate to Require Treasury to Share Epstein Records

author: Molly Smith
description: The US Department of Labor’s Office of Inspector General is initiating a review of “challenges” at the Bureau of Labor Statistics regarding collecting and reporting key economic data.
title: Labor Inspector General Initiates Review of BLS ‘Challenges’

author: Jim Wyss
description: Cuba’s entire energy grid collapsed again — at least the fourth national blackout in a year — as the island is mired in one of its deepest economic crises in decades.
title: Cuba Hit by Yet Another Nationwide Blackout as Power Plant Fails

author: Steven T. Dennis
description: The Senate Banking Committee voted along party lines to back the nomination of Donald Trump adviser Stephen Miran to a short-term post as a Federal Reserve governor, as Republicans moves swiftly to seat him before next week’s rate-setting meeting.
title: Senate Panel Backs Miran Fed Pick as GOP Moves for Fast Approval

author: Caitlin Reilly
description: Katherine Green, a dominatrix who creates online adult videos, wasn’t expecting a windfall from President Donald Trump’s signature push to make tips tax-free.
title: Podcasters and OnlyFans Creators Stand to Win Big Under Trump’s Tax Law

author: Gregory Korte
description: The Trump administration, intent on cutting costs on government contracts, is offering to pay federal employees as much as $10,000 for ideas that lead to verified savings.
title: Trump Administration Offers $10,000 Reward for Employee Ideas to Cut Costs

author: Anthony Capaccio
description: Air Force officials have told congressional auditors it’s feasible to extend, until 2050, Boeing Co.’s aging Minuteman III nuclear missiles that have been the ground-based leg of the US-nuclear triad arsenal for more than half a century.
title: Aging US Nuclear Missiles Could Be Extended Until 2050, Air Force Says

author: Courtney McBride, Josh Xiao
description: Defense Secretary Pete Hegseth spoke with his Chinese counterpart on Tuesday to assert that the US doesn’t seek conflict with Beijing nor is it pursuing regime change, the Pentagon said.
title: Hegseth Says US Not Seeking Conflict in Call to Chinese Minister

author: Prejula Prem
description: Higher shipments were driven by larger volumes from the port of Novorossiysk
title: Russia’s Crude Flows Jump to Three-Month High on Black Sea Surge

author: Alex Wickham, Ailbhe Rea
description: Prime Minister Keir Starmer faced cross-party questioning over the relationship between UK Ambassador to the US Peter Mandelson and disgraced financier Jeffrey Epstein, as the envoy’s position came under severe pressure.
title: Starmer’s Judgment Questioned Over Mandelson’s Epstein Links

author: Swati Gupta
description: The Himalayan nation of Nepal is experiencing its biggest political crisis since a decade-long civil war ended in 2006. Protesters set government buildings on fire, demanding an end to endemic corruption and greater employment opportunities for the country’s sizable young population. Law enforcement responded with tear gas and water cannon. At least 19 people were killed and hundreds injured.
title: What’s Behind the Deadly Riots That Brought Down Nepal’s Prime Minister?

author: Josh Wingrove
description: Former Vice President Kamala Harris said it was “recklessness” that led top Democrats to defer to then-President Joe Biden on whether he should seek reelection — the starkest comments yet from his top lieutenant after her defeat in the 2024 election.
title: Harris Says It Was Reckless for Democrats to Defer to Biden on Running Again

author: Daniel Carvalho
description: Brazil’s Supreme Court reconvened Wednesday on the precipice of a historic ruling: The first-ever conviction of a former president for attempting a coup in Latin America’s largest nation.
title: Brazil Judges Near Historic Verdict in Bolsonaro Coup Trial

author: Michael Nienaber
description: German lawmakers gave their formal approval for the government’s planned purchase of three additional Heron surveillance drones from Israel in a package worth nearly €1 billion ($1.2 billion).
title: German Lawmakers Approve €1 Billion Purchase of Israeli Drones

author: Charlie Duxbury
description: The Swedish government, facing an election next year, wants to hold children as young as 13 responsible for serious crimes in its latest push to crack down on violent gangs.
title: Sweden Seeks to Cut Age of Criminal Responsibility to 13

author: Annie Massa, Olga Kharif, Dylan Sloan
description: From all appearances, this should be a crowning moment for Cameron and Tyler Winklevoss.
title: Winklevosses Lean on MAGA Clout as Gemini’s Losses Mount Ahead of IPO

author: William Horobin, Samy Adghirni
description: Sebastien Lecornu took over as France’s prime minister pledging big changes as he tries to engage opposition parties in the herculean task of reining in the country’s debt amid hostility to budget cuts.
title: France’s New Premier Pledges Big Changes to Work With Opposition

author: Kari Lundgren
description: Norway’s $2 trillion sovereign wealth fund is looking to expand its renewables investments, including into assets such as power grids, according to its global head of energy and infrastructure.
title: Norway’s $2 Trillion Fund Looks to Expand Renewables Investments

author: Josh Xiao
description: China will establish a nature reserve at a disputed shoal in the South China Sea, a step that will likely inflame tensions with Manila in the resource-rich waterway.
title: China to Set Up Nature Reserve at Disputed South China Sea Shoal

author: Randy Thanthong-Knight
description: A slight majority of Canadians believe Prime Minister Mark Carney’s plan to run deeper deficits will grow the economy, accepting his argument that more spending is needed to emerge stronger from the US trade war.
title: Canadians Back Carney’s Deficit and Defense Plans, Poll Shows

author: Ignacio Olivera Doll
description: Buried underneath the headlines trumpeting the lopsided electoral defeat suffered by President Javier Milei’s party this weekend was a development potentially even more troubling for investors in Argentina: the re-emergence of Axel Kicillof.
title: The Anti-Milei Emerges, Worsening Investor Jitters in Argentina

author: Paul Wallace
description: Attack aimed at killing top Hamas officials was humiliating for Qatar and Arab neighbors such as Saudi Arabia and the UAE
title: Israel’s Air Strike on Qatar Threatens Mideast Escalation

author: Ethan Bronner
description: As condemnations of Israel’s bombing of Hamas leaders in Qatar erupted across the globe late Tuesday, Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu was taking the podium at a belated US Independence Day celebration put on by the American embassy in Jerusalem.
title: Qatar Bombing Shows Israel’s Belief That Strength Will Win Out

author: Patpicha Tanakasempipat
description: Cambodia and Thailand have agreed to gradually withdraw heavy weapons from their disputed border and cooperate on landmine clearances, key steps toward de-escalating tensions after violent clashes in July killed dozens.
title: Cambodia, Thailand Agree on Weapons Withdrawal to Ease Tensions

author: Shawna Kwan
description: Hong Kong’s legislature rejected a landmark bill that would have formally recognized same-sex partnerships, disappointing gay couples while plunging the city into legal uncertainty by defying a top court order.
title: Hong Kong Fails First Bid to Recognize Same-Sex Partnerships

author: Jana Randow
description: Montenegrin Prime Minister Milojko Spajic said central-bank independence is sacrosanct, despite his party standing in the way of appointments there for months.
title: Montenegro’s Premier Says He’d Never Interfere With Central Bank

author: Oscar Medina
description: Colombia’s leftist leader Gustavo Petro is enjoying an unexpected comeback, defying critics who dismissed him as an unpopular lame duck whose movement would be crushed in 2026 elections.
title: Written Off by Market, Colombia’s Leader Makes Surprise Comeback

author: Yazhou Sun
description: The European Commission said it would examine possible restrictions on social media for children under 16 years old following similar rules planned in Australia.
title: Europe Will Study Social Media Bans for Children Under 16

author: Rajesh Kumar Singh
description: India’s move to revise the consumption tax structure comes at a perfect time for state miner Coal India Ltd., which is battling plateauing demand and bloated inventories.
title: Tax Overhaul Boosts Coal India’s Push to Replace Pricey Imports

author: Linda Lew
description: Chinese regulators have launched a three-month campaign to crack down on advertising practices carried out by automakers and media companies that they describe as illegal and which may have contributed to “online chaos.”
title: China Takes Aim at Car Industry Fraudulent Advertising Tactics

author: Erica Yokoyama
description: Japan’s former Foreign Minister Toshimitsu Motegi entered the ruling party leadership race, saying he expected the central bank to keep moving away from easy money while he promised more cash for the regions to deal with inflation.
title: Japan’s Motegi Joins LDP Race, Says BOJ Should Keep Normalizing

author: Konrad Krasuski
description: Polish stocks retreated along with the local currency after the country shot down several Russian drones that crossed into its territory.
title: Polish Stocks and Currency Drop After Russia Drone Incursion

author: Jonathan Tirone
description: Iran took a step toward breaking the impasse with United Nations inspectors over access to its nuclear facilities, with a top-level meeting in Cairo yielding the groundwork for a return of monitors potentially as soon as next month, according to two diplomats familiar with the situation.
title: Iran Takes Step Toward Breaking Deadlock With UN Atomic Watchdog

author: Eva Brendel
description: A massive power outage that has affected tens of thousands of Berlin residents continued into its second day, with a full restoration not expected until Thursday evening.
title: Berlin Power Outage Enters Second Day With 20,000 Still Cut Off

author: Soo-Hyang Choi, Heesu Lee
description: South Korea said a chartered plane that’s set to return workers detained in an immigration raid won’t be able to leave the US on Wednesday.
title: South Korea Jet Set to Return Detainees Can’t Leave US Wednesday

author: Jorge Valero, Andrea Palasciano, Alberto Nardelli
description: The European Union’s top official warned that the bloc will need to reinvent itself to establish a place in a new global order that’s becoming antagonistic to its values and approach to democracy.
title: Von Der Leyen Urges EU to Fight for a Place in a Hostile World

author: Shruti Srivastava
description: India’s cabinet will consider proposals for a broad support package for exporters hit by the US tariffs, people familiar with the matter said, as the South Asian nation braces for an uncertain future with its largest export destination.
title: India Plans Relief Package for Exporters Hit by Trump’s Tariffs

author: Alisha Sachdev
description: BYD Co. is gearing up for a renewed push into India, according to people familiar with the matter, as warming diplomatic ties pave the way for the Chinese electric-vehicle giant to penetrate the world’s most populous country.
title: BYD’s Senior Management Set to Visit India as Modi-Xi Reset Ties

author: Heesu Lee, Hyonhee Shin
description: The detention of hundreds of South Korean workers at a battery plant in Georgia last week raises questions about how aggressively firms can invest in America when the Trump administration takes a harder line on visa paperwork.
title: Why Trump Immigration Raid Snared South Korea Workers Over Visas

author: Eltaf Najafizada
description: The Nepali Army deployed troops on Kathmandu’s streets Tuesday evening to contain the violent unrest that forced the political leadership to step down, fueling instability in the South Asian nation.
title: Nepal Army Moves to Quell Protest as Political Uncertainty Grows

author: Samy Adghirni, William Horobin, James Regan
description: Sebastien Lecornu will become prime minister of France Wednesday amid mass protests, underscoring the daunting task that awaits him as he tries to push through unpopular budget reforms.
title: Macron’s New Premier to Face Protests on First Day in Office

author: Philip Aldrick
description: Stubborn inflation has emerged as one of the biggest drawbacks from Chancellor of the Exchequer Rachel Reeves’ first budget. She risks repeating the result with her second.
title: Reeves Risks Another Post-Budget Inflation Surge, Business Warns

author: Grace Sihombing
description: Over the last weekend in August, after her house was ransacked by looters, Indonesia’s then-Finance Minister Sri Mulyani Indrawati traveled to President Prabowo Subianto’s country estate in the Hambalang hills in West Java. She planned to resign.
title: Indonesia President Prabowo Fired Indrawati After She Offered to Resign Twice

author: Cliff Harvey Venzon
description: Philippine President Ferdinand Marcos Jr. said his country is open to cooperating with other nations, but he stressed that respect for sovereignty is non-negotiable.
title: Marcos Says Respect for Philippine Sovereignty Non-Negotiable

author: Erik Larson, Zoe Tillman
description: A judge temporarily blocked President Donald Trump from removing Federal Reserve Governor Lisa Cook, allowing her to remain on the job as she challenges the president’s efforts to oust her over allegations she committed mortgage fraud.
title: Trump Can’t Fire Fed Governor Lisa Cook for Now, Judge Says

author: Swati Pandey
description: Australia will invest A$1.7 billion ($1.1 billion) to develop and manufacture a long-range autonomous vehicle, known as ghost shark, as the nation boosts its naval capabilities, Deputy Prime Minister Richard Marles said.
title: Australia to Spend $1.1 Billion on Autonomous Undersea Vehicles

author: Michael Heath
description: Poland scrambled military jets and shut a major airport in its capital after reports that Russian strike drones crossed into the nation’s airspace from neighboring Ukraine.
title: Poland Scrambles Jets, Shuts Warsaw Airport Over Russian Drones

author: Michael J Kavanagh
description: Rebels with ties to the Islamic State killed at least 89 people in eastern Democratic Republic of Congo in attacks Monday, the government said.
title: Islamist Rebels Kill 89 in Eastern Congo, Government Says

author: Lauren Dezenski
description: President Donald Trump said he plans to deploy federal troops to another US city, as he made a surprise visit to a Washington, DC, restaurant in a bid to argue his federal takeover of the city’s law enforcement is working.
title: Trump Visits DC Restaurant and Says He’ll Send Troops to Another City
